intro: Euphrasia wettsteinii var. botniensium, commonly known as the Botnienskaya eyebright, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers with prominent yellow spots. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
